question_sets.context:
Do you live in a city? Do you know how cities begin? Long ago, the world had only a few thousand people. These people moved from place to place. They moved over the land, hunting (打猎) animals for food.
No one knows how or where these people learned about growing food. But when they did, their lives (生活) changed. They didn't have to look for food any more. They could stay in one place and grow it.
People began to live near one another. And so the first villages grew.
Many people came to work in the village. These villages grew very big.
When machines came along (出现), life in the villages changed again. Factories were built (建立). More and more people lived near the factories. The cities grew very big.
Today, some people are moving back to small towns. Can you tell why?

questions.text: Long ago, a few people could stay in one place, hunting animals for food.
questions.explanation: Long ago, people moved from place to place to hunt animals for food.

questions.text: When these people learned to grow food, their lives changed.
questions.explanation: When they learned to grow food, their lives changed.

questions.text: Factories were built after the cities grew big.
questions.explanation: Factories were built and then the cities grew big.

questions.text: Today, some people don't live to live in big cities.
questions.explanation: Today, some people are moving back to small towns.

questions.text: Everyone knows how and where cities began.
questions.explanation: No one knows how and where cities began.

question_sets.context: A good breakfast is important. It is not hard to understand. You have had nothing to eat for about twelve hours all the night. Your body needs food for morning activities. One good breakfast should be rice or bread, an egg, milk and fruit. On a cold morning, a cup of hot drink is necessary. You must get up early to have enough(足够的time to eat breakfast. A good breakfast helps you to be more healthy and also to work better and play more happily. All your day will be more fun after you have a good breakfast.

questions.text: It’s important to have a good breakfast.
questions.explanation: The passage begins by stating that 'A good breakfast is important'.

questions.text: Rice and bread are good for breakfast.
questions.explanation: The passage suggests that 'One good breakfast should be rice or bread'.

questions.text: A good breakfast is helpful to you.
questions.explanation: The passage states that 'A good breakfast helps you to be more healthy and also to work better'.

questions.text: It’s not good to go to school with no breakfast.
questions.explanation: The passage implies this by stating that 'Your body needs food for morning activities'.

questions.text: It’s not necessary to have a breakfast.
questions.explanation: The passage emphasizes the importance of breakfast.

question_sets.context:
A man went to see his doctor one day because he was suffering (遭受……痛苦) from pains in his stomach. After the doctor had examined him carefully, he said to him.“Well, there’s nothing really wrong with you, I’m glad to say. Your only trouble is that you worry too much. Do you know, I had a man with the same trouble as you in here a few weeks ago, and I gave him the same advice as I’m going to give you. He was worried because he couldn’t pay his tailor’s bills. I told him not to worry about the bills any more. He followed my advice, and when he came to see me again two days ago, he told me that he now feels quite all right again.”
   “Yes, I know all about that,” answered the patient sadly. “You see, I’m that man’s tailor.”
根据短文内容判断正(T)误(F).

questions.text: The man’s pains in the stomach was caused by too much worry.
questions.explanation: The doctor states the man's only trouble is that he worries too much.

questions.text: The doctor’s earlier patient had made some clothes for the new one.
questions.explanation: The new patient is the tailor, meaning he made clothes for the earlier patient.

questions.text: The earlier patient wasn’t worried any more, because he had paid for the tailor.
questions.explanation: The earlier patient wasn't worried because he followed the advice and stopped worrying about the bills.

questions.text: The tailor was worried that the man whom he made clothes for would not give the money to him.
questions.explanation: The tailor is worried because his customer isn't paying the bills.

questions.text: The doctor wasn’t a doctor , but a chief.
questions.explanation: The passage explicitly refers to the doctor as a doctor.

question_sets.context: Mr. Smith was old, so it was often difficult for him to remember things. However, he still liked travelling very much, so he and his wife went to France every year. One summer when they were there, they went to visit their friends, the Whites. They had two young daughters. One afternoon Mr. Smith was talking to one of the girls in the garden after lunch. “You and your sister were ill when my wife and I were here last year, weren’t you?” he said to her. “Yes, we were.” answered the girl. “We were very ill.” The old man said nothing for a moment, because he was thinking. Then at last he said, “Oh, yes, I remember now! one of you died. Which one of you was it, you or your sister?” The girl answered, “It was me.” “Oh? I’m very sorry to hear it”, said the old man.

questions.text: The old man had a good memory.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions 'Mr. Smith was old, so it was often difficult for him to remember things'.

questions.text: What the old man said was true.
questions.explanation: The old man said that one of the girls was dead, but the girl that talked to him was still alive.

questions.text: The girl was very ill and died.
questions.explanation: The girl was alive.

questions.text: The girl didn’t die last year.
questions.explanation: The girl was alive.

questions.text: The girl and her sister were both very ill.
questions.explanation: The passage says 'You and your sister were ill when my wife and I were here last year'. The girl answered 'Yes, we were. We were very ill.'
